title: Manage Firefox data collection and privacy settings
summary: Manage Firefox’s data collection settings, including technical and interaction data, crash reports and the daily usage ping.
html:
Firefox handles data with transparency—learn more about what that means for you. Read the Firefox Privacy Notice.

Firefox balances privacy with performance by collecting limited data, such as usage trends, crash reports, and system details, to improve stability and functionality. This article provides an overview of what’s included in your system settings, where you can control data collection and usage on desktop; guidance is also available for mobile.

Manage settings involving data collection on desktop

Manage technical and interaction data, studies, the daily usage ping, the automatic sending of crash reports and Firefox Suggest

  1. Open Firefox Settings: In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. In the left-hand menu, click Privacy & Security.
  3. Scroll down to the Firefox Data Collection and Use section.
  4. Uncheck or check the following options based on your preferences:
    • Send technical and interaction data to Mozilla – Helps improve Firefox features, performance and stability. For details, see Manage technical and interaction data collection settings in Firefox.
    • Also enables:
      • Allow personalized extension recommendations – Provides tailored extension suggestions.
      • Install and run studies – Allows Mozilla to test experimental features before public release. For details, see About Studies.
    • Send daily usage ping to Mozilla – Helps Mozilla estimate the number of active users. For details, see Manage daily usage ping data collection settings in Firefox.
    • Automatically send crash reports – Sends crash data to help diagnose and fix browser issues. For details, see Crash reports in Firefox for Desktop.
    • Improve the Firefox Suggest experience – Allows Mozilla to process your search query data to develop the Firefox Suggest feature. To learn more, see Firefox Suggest FAQ and How to customize Firefox Suggest settings.
  5. Your changes are saved automatically. Close the Settings tab when done.

Manage technical and interaction data, studies, crash report settings and Firefox Suggest

  1. In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. In the left-hand menu, click Privacy & Security.
  3. Scroll down to the Firefox Data Collection and Use section.
  4. Uncheck or check the following options based on your preferences:
  • Allow Firefox to send technical and interaction data to Mozilla – Helps improve Firefox features, performance, and stability. For details, see Manage technical and interaction data collection settings in Firefox. This setting also disables or enables:
    • Allow Firefox to make personalized extension recommendations – Provides tailored extension suggestions.
    • Allow Firefox to install and run studies – Allows Mozilla to test experimental features before public release. For details, see About Studies.
  • Allow Firefox to send backlogged crash reports on your behalf – Sends crash data to Mozilla, to help diagnose and fix browser issues.
  • Improve the Firefox Suggest experience – Allows Mozilla to process your search query data to develop the Firefox Suggest feature. To learn more, see Firefox Suggest FAQ.
  • Allow Firefox to send technical and interaction data to Mozilla – Helps improve Firefox features, performance, and stability. For details, see Manage technical and interaction data collection settings in Firefox. This setting also disables or enables:
    • Allow Firefox to make personalized extension recommendations – Provides tailored extension suggestions.
  • Allow Firefox to install and run studies – Allows Mozilla to test experimental features before public release. For details, see About Studies.
  • Allow Firefox to send backlogged crash reports on your behalf – Sends crash data to Mozilla, to help diagnose and fix browser issues.
  • Improve the Firefox Suggest experience – Allows Mozilla to process your search query data to develop the Firefox Suggest feature. To learn more, see Firefox Suggest FAQ.

Your changes are saved automatically. Close the Settings tab when done.

Manage sponsored content data, recent activity and weather

  1. Click the gear icon at the top right corner of your New Tab page. A panel will open, showing content you can customize.
  2. Click the toggle next to a section to switch it on or off to show or hide that section. To opt in or opt out of sponsored content, check or uncheck those options.
    • Shortcuts > Sponsored shortcuts – Provides the ability to turn on or off sponsored shortcuts on the New Tab page. For details, see Sponsors on the home page and New Tab page.
    • Recommended stories > Sponsored stories – Provides the ability to turn on or off sponsored stories on the New Tab page. For details, see Pocket sponsored stories on new tabs.
    • Recent activity – Provides the ability to turn on or off thumbnails displaying recent downloads, sites or bookmarks. For details, see Customize items on Firefox > Recent Activity.
    • Weather – Provides the ability to turn on or off the weather widget. For details, see Customize items on Firefox > Weather.
